title: Trump Taj Mahal Casino Opens with $675 Million Junk Bond Debt Crisis
summary: Donald Trump debuted his third Atlantic City casino, the Trump Taj Mahal, but was immediately struggling to make payments on $675 million in high-interest junk bonds used for construction. The casino opened during Trump's broader financial crisis involving several billion dollars in bank loans, nearly a billion guaranteed by his personal wealth, setting up the conditions for Carl Icahn's eventual involvement.

sources.title: Inside the rocky billionaire bromance of Donald Trump and Carl Icahn
